metadata.Title: CVE-2020-11935 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
It was discovered that aufs improperly managed inode reference counts in the vfsub_dentry_open() method. A local attacker could use this vulnerability to cause a denial of service attack. Mauricio Faria de Oliveira discovered that the aufs implementation in the Linux kernel improperly managed inode reference counts in the vfsub_dentry_open() method. A local attacker could use this vulnerability to cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-11935` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-186-generic - 4.4.0-186.216
linux-image-4.4.0-186-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-186.216
linux-image-4.4.0-186-lowlatency - 4.4.0-186.216
linux-image-4.4.0-186-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-186.216
linux-image-4.4.0-186-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-186.216
linux-image-4.4.0-186-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-186.216
linux-image-4.4.0-186-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-186.216
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-186-generic - 4.4.0-186.216
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-186-lowlatency - 4.4.0-186.216
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-186.216').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1111.123').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1079.83~16.04.1').

linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1080.90~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-112.113~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1077.84').

linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1050.54~16.04.1').
